revised_title: Observations on the Classification of Polyps and Their Ciliated Tentacula
tldr: The author studied the minute structure of higher forms of polyps and proposed a new classification system based on the presence of ciliated tentacula and a free alimentary canal with two orifices. He divided polyps into two subgroups: the Hydriform and Actiniform, or Zoanthiform, and proposed the name Ciliobrachiata for the group characterized by ciliated tentacula.
